Context:
1. Centre for Business courses take place at the following campuses: St. James Campus, Casa Loma Campus, and Waterfront Campus (for Spring 2023), and St. James Campus (for Fall 2023).
2. The School of Design is located in a 103,000-square-foot facility at Daniels Waterfront â€“ City of the Arts development.
3. Campus tours are available for prospective students to visit common areas such as cafeteria, library, gym, student services, and other facilities.
4. The main subway stops for Waterfront Campus are Union Station on Line 1 (Yonge-University), Castle Frank Station and Pape Station on Line 2 (Bloor-Danforth). Bus numbers to reach Dockside Drive are 19 Bay, 72B Pape.
5. Parking is available in the lower levels of 51 Dockside Drive. The entrance to Daniels City of the Arts parking garage is located on the East side of the building on Richardson St, Just north of Queens Quay.
6. The School of Design cannot be accessed directly from the parking garage. Visitors will have to take the elevator to the main condominium lobby, exit the building onto Queens Quay, and walk East up Lower Jarvis to reach the Campus doors.
7. Other parking lots around Waterfront Campus can be found at parkopedia.ca.
8. The School of Design and other campus information can be found at the following addresses: 3 Lower Jarvis Street, Toronto ON M5E 3Y5 and 51 Dockside Drive, Toronto ON M5A 1B6.
9. Information about land acknowledgment and application deadlines are also available on the college website.
